intro: Haemadictyon circinale, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, spiral-shaped thallus that forms a dense, cushion-like structure. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions on rocky surfaces or soil. Its structure consists of a central axis with branches that spiral around it, creating a unique and delicate appearance. Haemadictyon circinale plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
